metapodfromurdf

Usage:

metapodfromurdf [options] input-file

Introduction

metapodfromurdf is using urdfdom to parse the urdf file input-file and generate a C++ data structure. This data structure can be used by templates providing highly efficient implementations of algorithms such as inverse dynamics (RNEA), the inertia matrix (CRBA), and the hydrid dynamics (CHDA). This directory is specified by the option --directory.

Options:

  • --help
    produce help message

  • --config-file arg
    a config file which can store options

  • --name arg
    Option specifying the robot name (arg).

  • --libname arg
    the library name (arg) used for DLL symbol import/export. If omitted, the value of the name option will be used.

  • --directory arg
    arg is the name of the directory where the files will be generated

  • --license-file arg
    arg specify the license text, which will be copied on top of every generated file

  • --joint-dof-index arg
    arg is mapping joint name to dof index, in the form joint_name:dof_index, this option should be passed either for every joint of for none at all

  • --joint arg
    arg is the joint name, pass several of them to specify joints ordering

  • --prefer-fixed-axis
    use REVOLUTE_AXIS_X instead of REVOLUTE_AXIS_ANY when possible.
